src:
Že pri dvanajstih vedel, da bo kuharski chef
V restavraciji Kult 316 je gostoval Michelinov kuhar Vincent Foppen. Za pomočnike v kuhinji in pri strežbi si je sposodil študente gostinstva.
05 Nov 2019, 17:55 by Janez Petkovšek



Chef v akciji



Celotna kuharska in strežna ekipa ob koncu večera FOTOGRAFIJE: JANEZ PETKOVŠEK



Žan Prezelj, Vincent Foppen in Primož Valič (z leve), udarna trojka večera



Med pripravo mediteranskih specialitet



Pogled na šolsko kuhinjo v restavraciji Kult 316



Hrustljava svinjska trebuševina z babo hanoush, brokolijem in raz el hanoutom



Maroška začinjena krema z mariniranimi slivami, pistacijami in jogurtovim sladoledom


LJUBLJANA – Ne zgodi se pogosto, da k nam pride svoje znanje predstavit kuhar svetovnega slovesa, kaj šele da gre za mojstra, ki je kot chef de partie delal celo v newyorški restavraciji Eleven Madison Park. Še redkeje, da svoje specialitete pripravi v šolski restavraciji.


Hrustljava svinjska trebuševina z babo hanoush, brokolijem in raz el hanoutom

In pred nekaj dnevi se je prav to zgodilo v ljubljanski restavraciji Kult 316, kjer kuharsko in drugo gostinsko znanje pridobivajo študenti Biotehniškega izobraževalnega centra Ljubljana. Posebnost obiska Vincenta Foppna, nizozemskega kuharja, ki je bil v vlogi chefa v različnih vrhunskih restavracijah doma in v tujini, kot sous chef v nizozemskih restavracijah z eno Michelinovo zvezdico (De Echoput in De Hoefslag), nazadnje pa kot chef v elitni nizozemski restavraciji Za Amsterdam, je tudi njegova odprtost do šolajočih se kuharjev.


Žan Prezelj, Vincent Foppen in Primož Valič (z leve), udarna trojka večera

V šentviški restavraciji Kult 316 smo namreč lahko v živo opazovali šele 30 let starega kuharskega mojstra, ki je že pri 12 letih vedel, da bo nekoč postal chef, in to svojo vizijo tudi zelo hitro uresničil. S študenti ljubljanske višje šole za gostinstvo in turizem se je namreč ujel, kot da so že dolgo utečeni tim, ne pa da so se prvič srečali šele dva dni pred slavnostno večerjo za udeležence mednarodnega srečanja gostincev in živilcev ter ljubiteljev vrhunske hrane, ki so imeli srečo, da so se pravočasno prijavili za ta enkratni dogodek. Na njem je bilo namreč prostora le za približno 50 gostov. 
Uigrana trojka
No, kot nam je kasneje povedal eden od dveh glavnih Foppnovih pomočnikov, 21-letni študent drugega letnika višje šole za gostinstvo in turizem BIC Ljubljana Žan Prezelj, sta z nizozemskim mojstrom v kuhinji že prej delala kar dva ljubljanska študenta. Sam je bil v restavraciji Za Amsterdam v okviru Erazmusove izmenjave od maja do julija letos, leto prej pa je imel čast s Foppnom kuhati Primož Valič, ki je šolo že končal in ga čaka le še diploma. Svoje skrivnosti mu je razkrival v Bergnu na Norveškem.


Celotna kuharska in strežna ekipa ob koncu večera FOTOGRAFIJE: JANEZ PETKOVŠEK

In omenjena trojka je pri pripravi pethodnega mediteranskega menija ob pomoči številnega drugega kuharskega in strežnega podmladka delovala profesionalno, uglajeno in tekoče kot dobro namazan stroj. Prezelj nam je po koncu več kot triurne gastronomske predstave priznal, da je izmučen, saj so se na ta dogodek vsi skupaj pripravljali dan prej od 10. do 19. ure, naslednji dan pa od 10. do 23. ure, ko so odhajali še zadnji zadovoljni gostje. 
Mediteranski večer
Vincent Foppen je obiskovalce presenetil tako s ponudbo hrane kot vin, saj od Nizozemca niso pričakovali, da mu bo tako blizu mediteranska gastronomija. A je pojasnil, da je v mladosti veliko potoval po svetu in da so mu mediteranska vina in hrana zelo blizu, zato je bil večer v znamenju vrhunskih italijanskih, grških in španskih vin in aperitivov ter hrane Mediterana s pridihom afriške in azijske kuhinje.Čar večera pa ni bil le v uživanju hrane in pijače, temveč tudi v šovu, kuharji so namreč neobičajne kombinacije mesa, solat, prilog, sladic in drugih kulinaričnih dobrot pripravljali pred očmi gostov. In nemalo jih je od blizu spremljalo aranžiranje posameznih jedi, saj so jih večino pripravljali sproti oziroma so bile pripravljene le na pol. Vsak hod so napovedali, vsak krožnik so mladi natakarji ob vsaki mizi predstavili. Tako je vsakdo vedel, kakšne sestavine so v posamezni jedi oziroma za kakšne kombinacije gre.Prevandral ves svetVincent Foppen je začel kuhati, ko je bil star 15 let. Vsak teden je en dan preživel v šoli, od štiri do pet dni pa je delal v različnih kuhinjah. Restavracije je menjal vsako leto, da bi se naučil čim več različnih stvari. Po štirih letih kulinarične šole je šel še na dvoletno specializacijo, zatem pa je veliko potoval in spoznaval svet zunaj Evrope. V ZDA je poslal kar 50 prošenj za delo v slavnih restavracijah in na koncu mu je uspelo v znameniti Eleven Madison Park, kjer je bilo samo v kuhinji več kot 50 zaposlenih. Nato ga je pot zanesla na Norveško, kjer je pet let delal v restavraciji Lysverket in počasi postal glavni chef. Spoznal je najrazličnejše kuhinje, najbolj pa mu je bilo doslej všeč v Mehiki, Tokiu na Japonskem, Limi v Peruju, od mediteranskih držav pa v Izraelu.Ko so, denimo, ponudili suho grško belo vino kourtaki, smo izvedeli, da prihaja iz vinorodne pokrajine Atika in da se ima za svoj smolnat okus zahvaliti naključju; ko so to vino pred 3000 in več leti polnili v glinene amfore, so mnoge razpokale, in ker jih je bilo škoda metati stran, so špranje zalili kar s smolo, sčasoma pa se je njenega vonja in okusa navzelo tudi vino. In nastalo je posebno vino, ki je še danes uspešnica. 
Omamne jedi
Med jedmi je bilo za vsakogar nekaj. Za začetek so postregli paradižnikovo solato z meto, meliso in baziliko, falaflom, mariniranim jabolkom granny smith in dimljenim jogurtom. Sledilo je nadaljevanje s sveže pripravljenim tatarskim biftkom s toplim krompirjem in peno sira tallegio (kremni sir z močno aromo), hrustljavim kaprinim drobljencem in drobnjakom. Na morje je zatem spominjala hobotnica na žaru s humusom iz sladkega krompirja, svežimi grahovimi poganjki, krekerji s harisso (vrsta začimbe), sončničnimi in bučnimi semeni.Pridih Afrike je pričarala hrustljava svinjska trebuševina z libanonsko jedjo baba ganoush, brokolijem in raz el hanoutom. Za konec so postregli maroško začinjeno kremo z mariniranimi slivami, pistacijami in jogurtovim sladoledom. Piko na i je pričaral sladki kremni liker (premium cream sherry) iz španske vinorodne pokrajine Jerez.
29evrov je stal pethodni meni chefa Vincenta Foppna.
Za veliki finale se je s skupinsko fotografijo zahvalila še številna ekipa kuharjev, natakarjev študentov, pomožnega osebja, njihovih mentorjev in šefov. Kot se za chefa spodobi, se je Vincent Foppen zapletel v krajši pogovor pri številnih mizah, nam pa razkril, da ima z ženo za prihodnost velike načrte: trenutno gostujeta v Bergnu na Norveškem, mladi nizozemski kuhar pa si želi, da bi čim prej odprl lastno restavracijo v Oslu.
text:
At the age of twelve, he knew he would be a chef
Michelin-starred chef Vincent Foppen hosted the Kult 316 restaurant. He borrowed catering students for his assistants in the kitchen and at the office.
05 Nov 2019, 16:55 by Janez Petkovsek



Chef in action



The entire cooking and serving team at the end of the evening PHOTOS: JANEZ PETKOVŠEK



Jean Prezelj, Vincent Foppen and Primoz Valic (from left), the threesome of the evening



While preparing Mediterranean specialties



View of the school kitchen at Kult 316



Crispy pork belly with grandma hanoush, broccoli and raz el hanout



Moroccan spicy cream with marinated plums, pistachios and yogurt ice cream


LJUBLJANA - It doesn't happen often that a chef of world renown comes to our knowledge, let alone a master who has worked as a chef de partie even at New York's Eleven Madison Park restaurant. It is even rarer that he prepares his specialties in a school restaurant.


Crispy pork belly with grandma hanoush, broccoli and raz el hanout

And just a few days ago, this is exactly what happened at the Kult 316 restaurant in Ljubljana, where students from the Biotechnical Education Center of Ljubljana acquire cooking and other hospitality knowledge. A special feature of the visit is Vincent Foppen, a Dutch chef who has served as a chef at various top restaurants at home and abroad, as sous chef at Dutch Michelin star restaurants (De Echoput and De Hoefslag) and most recently as a chef at the elite Dutch restaurant Za Amsterdam is also open to chefs.


Jean Prezelj, Vincent Foppen and Primoz Valic (from left), the threesome of the evening

We were only able to watch live at the Kult 316 restaurant in Šentilj, only a 30-year-old chef, who knew at the age of 12 that he would someday become a chef, and very quickly realized that vision. He caught up with the students of the Ljubljana Higher School of Catering and Tourism as if they had been a long-established team, rather than meeting for the first time only two days before the formal dinner for the participants of the international meeting of caterers and food lovers who had lucky to have signed up for this one-off event in time. It only had room for about 50 guests.
Playful threesome
Well, as one of Foppn's two principal assistants later told us, a 21-year-old sophomore of the BIC Ljubljana Higher School of Hospitality and Tourism, Jean Prezelj, had previously worked with two Dutch students in the kitchen in the kitchen. He himself was at the restaurant Za Amsterdam as part of the Erasmus exchange from May to July this year, and the year before, he had the honor of cooking with Foppen, Primož Valič, who had already graduated from college and was still awaiting his degree. He revealed his secrets to him in Bergen, Norway.


The entire cooking and serving team at the end of the evening PHOTOS: JANEZ PETKOVŠEK

And, in the preparation of the five-course Mediterranean menu, the aforementioned troupe acted professionally, smoothly and fluently as a well-oiled machine with the help of numerous other cooking and serving youngsters. After over three hours of gastronomic performance, Prezelj confessed to him that he was exhausted, as everyone was preparing for this event the day before from 10am to 7pm, and the following day from 10am to 11pm leaving last satisfied guests.
Mediterranean evening
Vincent Foppen surprised visitors with both food and wine, as the Dutch were not expected to be so close to Mediterranean gastronomy. But he explained that he traveled extensively around the world at a young age, and that his Mediterranean wines and food were very close to him, so the evening was marked by top quality Italian, Greek and Spanish wines and aperitifs and Mediterranean food with a touch of African and Asian cuisine. not only enjoyed the food and drink, but also the show, the chefs prepared unusual combinations of meat, salads, side dishes, desserts and other culinary delicacies before the eyes of the guests. And quite a few of them were accompanied by the arrangement of individual dishes, as most of them were prepared on a regular basis, or they were only prepared in half. Every move was announced, every plate was presented by young waiters at every table. So everyone knew what the ingredients were in each dish or what combinations it was. The whole worldVincent Foppen started cooking when he was 15 years old. He spent one day at school each week, working from four to five days in different kitchens. He changed restaurants every year to learn as many different things as possible. After four years of culinary school he went on to two years of specialization, after which he traveled extensively and got to know the world outside Europe. In the US, he made 50 applications to work at celebrity restaurants, eventually succeeding in the famous Eleven Madison Park, where more than 50 employees were employed in the kitchen alone. He then made it to Norway, where he worked at Lysverket Restaurant for five years and slowly became a chef. He got to know a variety of cuisines, and he liked the most so far in Mexico, Tokyo, Japan, Lima in Peru, and the Mediterranean countries in Israel.When, for example, they offered dry Greek white kourtaki wine, we learned that it comes from the wine-growing region Attica and that it has a random taste to thank for its resinous taste; When this wine was bottled 3000 years ago in clay amphorae, many cracked, and because it was a shame to throw them away, the spit was poured with resin, and eventually the aroma and taste of the wine came. And a special wine was created, which is still a hit today.
Stunning dishes
There was something for everyone to eat. For starters, they served tomato salad with mint, lemon balm and basil, falafle, marinated granny smith apple and smoked yogurt. This was followed by a freshly made Tatar steak with hot potatoes and foam cheese tallegio (cream cheese with a strong aroma), crispy caprine chives and chives. The sea was then reminiscent of grilled octopus with sweet potato hummus, fresh pea shoots, harissa crackers, sunflower seeds and pumpkin seeds. In the end, they served Moroccan spicy cream with marinated plums, pistachios and yogurt ice cream. The sweetness of the premium cream sherry from Jerez, the Spanish wine-growing region, sparked the touch.
Chef Vincent Foppen's five-course menu stood 29 euros.
The team finale was thanked for the grand finale by a team of chefs, student waiters, support staff, their mentors and bosses. As the chef looks like, Vincent Foppen got into a brief conversation at a number of tables, revealing to us that he has big plans for his future: they are currently roaming in Bergen, Norway, and the young Dutch chef wants to open as soon as possible Oslo's own restaurant.
